tool.name: Create Muspinsim input file

param.name: out_file_prefix
param.label: A prefix for all output files (default muspinsim)

param.name: spin_preset
param.label: Choose from species, or choose 'custom' to enter your own

param.name: atomic_mass
param.label: Custom Atomic Mass, Leave blank to use default symbol mass

param.name: zeeman_index
param.label: Index of coupled spin (index starts from 1)

param.name: zeeman_vector
param.label: Vector for Zeeman coupling (Tesla)
param.help: Define 1X3 vector for local magnetic field coupling. Allows default expressions, constants and functions (see help)

param.name: hfine_index
param.label: Index of non-electron spin (index starts from 1)

param.name: hfine_e_index
param.label: Index of electron spin
param.help: Optional, will use first defined electron if unspecified

param.name: hfine_matrix
param.label: 3x3 Tensor for hyperfine coupling (MHz)
param.help: Define 3X3 tensor for coupling between electron and non-electron spins. Allows default expressions, constants and functions (see help)

param.name: di_index
param.label: Index of first dipolar spin (index starts from 1)

param.name: di_vector
param.label: Vector for dipole coupling (Angstrom)
param.help: Define 1X3 vector for coupling between two spins. Allows default expressions, constants and functions (see help)

param.name: quad_index
param.label: Index of coupled spin (index starts from 1)

param.name: quad_matrix
param.label: 3x3 Electric Field Gradient Tensor (in atomic units) for quadrupolar coupling
param.help: Define 3X3 tensor. Allows default expressions, constants and functions (see help). Warning: spins with zero quadrupole moment will have zero coupling regardless of the input

param.name: dis_index
param.label: Index of spin to be given dissipation term (index starts from 1)

param.name: dis_val
param.label: Enter dissipation value (MHz)
param.help: Define dissipation term. Allows default expressions, constants and functions (see help)

param.name: experiment_preset
param.label: Choose an experiment type, or custom to define own params
param.help: `alc` - Avoided Level Crossing, `zero field` - No external, `custom` - No preset values fields, (See muspinsim docs 'experiment' keyword for more info)

param.name: field
param.label: Enter field to simulate, either scalar of vector
param.help: Optional, (default is 0). Accepts 1X3 vector, or scalar value. Scalar value means field is assumed to be aligned with z axis. Allows default expressions, constants and functions. Including MHz, muon_gyr constants and special 'range()' function (see help section)

param.name: x_axis
param.label: Choose which range to use as x axis for output file(s)

param.name: y_axis
param.label: Choose which range to use as y axis for output file(s)
param.help: Asymmetry: Use muon's polarization, Integral: use muon's polarization integral over time, WARNING: if integral chosen, 'time' parameter is ignored, and cannot be used as x-axis parameter

param.name: x_axis
param.label: Choose which range to use as x axis for output file(s)

param.name: y_axis
param.label: Choose which range to use as y axis for output file(s)
param.help: Asymmetry: Use muon's polarization, Integral: use muon's polarization integral over time, WARNING: if integral chosen, 'time' parameter is ignored, and cannot be used as x-axis parameter

param.name: field
param.label: Enter field to simulate, either scalar of vector
param.help: Optional, (default is 0). Accepts 1X3 vector, or scalar value. Scalar value means field is assumed to be aligned with z axis. Allows default expressions, constants and functions. Including MHz, muon_gyr and special 'range()' function (see help section)

param.name: polarization_preset
param.label: Choose direction muon polarization will be measured
param.help: transverse - shorthand for along x-axis, longitudinal - shorthand for along z-axis

param.name: polarization
param.label: Enter custom vector for polarization
param.help: Accepts 1X3 vector. Allows default expressions, constants and functions (see help section)

param.name: average_axes
param.label: Choose keywords that should have an average carried out over them
param.help: Any keywords not included here or as x-axis are included in separate files

param.name: euler_convention
param.label: Define euler angle convention (ignored if euler angles not defined)

repeat.name: orientations
repeat.title: Orientations to use for crystallites - (define powder averages)

param.name: orientation_preset
param.label: Choose orientation type to define
param.help: Polar angles: Define two polar angles theta and phi, defining only the direction of the z-axis (recommended for powder averages). Euler angles: Define 3 euler angles defining a new frame, convention used is ZYZ by default. Euler angles with weight: define 3 euler angles and a weight (will be normalized automatically). Euler angles helper function: eulrange(n). Zaremba-Conroy-Wolfsberg helper function: zcw(n)

param.name: eul_n
param.label: value for n for eulrange(n)
param.help: Enter number (larger numbers are more computationally expensive). Allows default expressions, constants and functions

param.name: zcw_n
param.label: value for n for zcw(n)
param.help: Enter number (larger numbers are more computationally expensive). 09Allows default expressions, constants and functions

param.name: theta
param.label: theta polar angle
param.help: Allows default expressions, constants and functions

param.name: eul_1
param.label: enter euler angle
param.help: Allows default expressions, constants and functions

param.name: eul_1
param.label: enter euler angle
param.help: Allows default expressions and constants

repeat.name: times
repeat.title: A time or range of times, in microseconds, to simulate

param.name: time
param.label: Enter time to simulate, either single time or `range` function
param.help: Optional, (default is range(0, 10, 101)). Allows default expressions, default constants, and special 'range()' function (see help section)

repeat.name: temperatures
repeat.title: Temperature in Kelvin of the system

param.name: temperature
param.label: Enter temp to simulate, either single value or 'range()' function
param.help: Optional, (default is 'inf' - infinity). Allows default expressions, default constants, and special 'range()' function (see help section). Warning: both density matrices and dissipative couplings for finite temperatures are only calculated approximatively, see muspinsim docs.

param.name: fitting
param.label: Fit experimental data with simulations
param.help: Fitting requires a file with data to fit. File must be given in muspinsim tool, or by manually setting filepath for keyword 'fitting_data' if running muspinsim externally

param.name: fitting_method
param.label: Method to use to fit the data
param.help: Currently available are only nelder-mead (default) and lbfgs

repeat.name: fitting_variables
repeat.title: Variable to fit to the experimental data

param.name: start_val
param.label: Starting value
param.help: Optional, default is 0. Each entry allows default expressions, constants (including MHz, muon_gyr) and functions but cannot contain names of other variables

param.name: min_bound
param.label: minimum bound
param.help: Optional, default is -inf

param.name: max_bound
param.label: maximum bound
param.help: Optional, default is inf

param.name: fitting_tolerance
param.label: Tolerance for the fitting.
param.help: Used as the tol parameter in Scipy's scipy.optimize.minimize method. Does not accept expressions/functions/constants

tool.help:
Tool to create input parameter file for Muspinsim.
This tool creates a structured text file with keywords and values which describe the system to model for Muspinsim. See muspinsim docs for more information https://muon-spectroscopy-computational-project.github.io/muspinsim/input/.
Muspinsim allows expressions and special functions to be used when defining certain keywords. This tool also allows this. Check the hint at the bottom of each input to see what, if any, special function or expressions can be used.
Default expressions include the use of the operators \+, \-, \*, \/ and \^ for exponentiation.
Default constants include: - pi: ratio of a circle and its diameter - e: base of the natural logarithm - deg: conversion factor between radians and degrees, equivalent to 180/pi - inf: infinity
Special constants include: - muon_gyr: gyromagnetic ratio of muon (135.5388 MHz/T) - MHz: `1/2*muon_gyr`
Default functions include: - sin(x): sine - cos(x): cosine - tan(x): tangent - arcsin(x): inverse of the sine - arccos(x): inverse of the cosine - arctan(x): inverse of the tangent - arctan2(y, x): inverse of the tangent taking two arguments as (sine, cosine) to resolve the quadrant - exp(x): exponential with base e - log(x): natural logarithm - sqrt(x): square root
Special functions include: - range(x, y, z): get z equally spaced values between x and y - zcw(n): Zaremba-Conroy-Wolfsberg helper function - eulrange(n): helper function to create regular grid of NxNxN Euler angles with appropriate weights.
